item.title: Individual Cybersecurity
item.description: small preamble about how this is just me talking right into the void its just a way to note a checklist to track what i still need to do also, i didnt feel like formatting this one so fuck you future me password management pw manager, use different, random passwords for everything Backups (incl. offsite server) store important data (especially the pw database) on backup drives. setup a small offsite server (like a raspberry pi with a harddrive attached) as an offsite backup, so in case of fire or something that destroys your data at home you dont lose all your passwords / accounts also print out your pw db for exmample from time to time.

item.title: What even is a 10x-Dev?
item.description: One of the reasons I am starting this blog is my interest in the concept of the 10x developer. Said to be ten times as efficient as their coworkers, these mystical creatures would be the pinnacle of modern software development, envied by their peers and searched for by hiring teams around the world. So, the question I want to answer is: Is the concept of the 10x developer real or just that: A concept.

item.title: Hello World
